[[Florent Fremont]] | area_served = [[World]]wide | location_city = [[Paris]] | location_country = [[France]] | key_people = [[Freddy Mini]] ([[CEO]]), [[Annabelle Malherbe]] ([[Managing Director]]) | url = [http://www.netvibes.com/ www.netvibes.com] | launch_date = 2005 | current_status = Active | language = [[Multilingual]] }} '''Netvibes''' is a personalized dashboard publishing platform for the Web including digital life management, widget distribution services and brand observation rooms. ==History== [[File:Mike Arrington and Tariq Krim 2008 WEF.jpg|thumb|right|[[Mike Arrington]] and Tariq Krim, one of Netvibes' co-founders.]] The company was founded by [[Tariq Krim]] [[:fr:Tariq Krim|{{fr}}]] and [[Florent FrÃ©mont]] in 2005. ==Technology== Netvibes is a multi-lingual [[Ajax (programming)|Ajax]]-based personalized [[start page]] or personal [[web portal]] much like [[My Yahoo!]], [[iGoogle]] or [[Pageflakes]]. It is organized into tabs, with each tab containing user-defined modules. Built-in Netvibes modules include an [[RSS (file format)|RSS]]/[[Atom (standard)|Atom]] feed reader, local weather forecasts, a calendar supporting [[iCal]], bookmarks, notes, to-do lists, multiple searches, support for [[POP3]], [[IMAP4]] email as well as several [[webmail]] providers including [[Gmail]], [[Yahoo Mail]], [[Hotmail]], and [[AOL Mail]], [[Box.net]] web storage, [[Delicious (website)|Delicious]], [[Meebo]], [[Flickr]] photos, [[podcast]] support with a built-in audio player, and several others.
A page can be personalized further through the use of existing themes or by creating personal theme. Customized tabs, feeds and modules can be shared with others individually or via the Netvibes Ecosystem.{{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= | title=Cnet-News | date= | publisher= | url =http://news.cnet.com/8301-10784_3-9797821-7.html | work = | pages = | accessdate = 2008-06-18 | language = }} For privacy reasons, only modules with publicly available content can be shared. {{cite news | first= | last= | coauthors= | title=Netvibe on Wired | date= | publisher= | url =http://www.wired.com/software/softwarereviews/news/2007/02/72673 | work = | pages = | accessdate = 2008-06-18 | language = }} ==The Netvibes Ecosystem== [[Image:Netvibes-player.png|right|thumb|Netvibes supports podcasts with built-in audio player]] The Netvibes Ecosystem is a collection of user submitted modules/widgets built using [http://dev.netvibes.com/doc/ Netvibes Universal Widget API (UWA)], feeds, podcasts, events, tabs, and "universes". ==See also== *[[News aggregator]] *[[Pageflakes]] *[[iGoogle]] *[[Bing (search engine)|Bing]] *[[Yahoo.com]] *[[Sthrt]] *[[Web Desktop]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{official|netvibes.com}} {{Widget engine}} [[Category:News aggregators]] [[Category:Web 2.0]] [[Category:Web portals]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2005]] [[Category:2005 establishments in France]] [[Category:Software companies of France]] {{web-stub}} [[ar:ÙØªÙØ§ÙØ¨Ø²]] [[bg:Netvibes]] [[de:Netvibes]] [[es:Netvibes]] [[eo:Netvibo]] [[fr:Netvibes]] [[gl:Netvibes]] [[it:Netvibes]] [[ku:Netvibes]] [[nl:Netvibes]] [[ja:Netvibes]] [[no:Netvibes]] [[nn:Netvibes]] [[pt:Netvibes]] [[ru:Netvibes]] [[tr:Netvibes]] [[uk:Netvibes]] [[zh:Netvibes]]
